solution: The smallest circle has radius 2, so the next largest circle has radius 4.  The area inside the circle of radius 4 not inside the circle of radius 2 is equal to the difference: $$\pi\cdot4^2-\pi\cdot2^2=16\pi-4\pi=12\pi$$ This area has been divided into twelve small congruent sections by the radii shown, and the shaded region is one of these.  Thus, the area of the shaded region is: $$12\pi\cdot\frac{1}{12}=\boxed{\pi}$$
